title: Estimating Stochastic Block Models in the Presence of Covariates
abstract: arXiv:2402.16322v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: In the standard stochastic block model for networks, the probability of a connection between two nodes, often referred to as the edge probability, depends on the unobserved communities each of these nodes belongs to. We consider a flexible framework in which each edge probability, together with the probability of community assignment, are also impacted by observed covariates. We propose a computationally tractable two-step procedure to estimate the conditional edge probabilities as well as the community assignment probabilities. The first step relies on a spectral clustering algorithm applied to a localized adjacency matrix of the network. In the second step, k-nearest neighbor regression estimates are computed on the extracted communities. We study the statistical properties of these estimators by providing non-asymptotic bounds.

translated_title: 在考虑协变量的情况下估计随机块模型
translated_abstract: 在网络的标准随机块模型中，两个节点之间的连接概率（通常称为边缘概率）取决于这些节点所属的未观察到的社区。我们考虑了一个灵活的框架，其中每个边缘概率以及社区分配概率还受到观测到的协变量的影响。我们提出了一个可计算的两步过程，用于估计条件边缘概率以及社区分配概率。第一步依赖于应用于网络的局部邻接矩阵的谱聚类算法。在第二步中，对提取的社区进行k最近邻回归估计。我们通过提供非渐近界限来研究这些估计量的统计特性。
tldr: 考虑协变量的情况下提出了一个可计算的两步过程来估计随机块模型中的条件边缘概率和社区分配概率，并研究了这些估计量的统计特性
en_tdlr: A computationally tractable two-step procedure is proposed to estimate the conditional edge probabilities and community assignment probabilities in a stochastic block model, taking into account covariates, and the statistical properties of these estimators are studied.
